trans-unit.source: Native push campaigns are only available for iOS and Windows Phone applications and they will use the one shot push mode by default.
trans-unit.target: Native push campaigns are only available for iOS and Windows Phone applications and they will use the one shot push mode by default.

trans-unit.source: In this mode, the campaign will be delivered only to your existing users.
trans-unit.target: In this mode, the campaign will be delivered only to your existing users.

trans-unit.source: Unique name of the campaign (64 characters max).
trans-unit.target: Unique name of the campaign (64 characters max).

trans-unit.source: Specify which users will be targeted by this campaign (65535 bytes max, see <link xlink:href="9046ef43-ddfc-4be1-b52c-2504bd9d3097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Audience Format</link>).
trans-unit.target: Specify which users will be targeted by this campaign (65535 bytes max, see <link xlink:href="9046ef43-ddfc-4be1-b52c-2504bd9d3097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Audience Format</link>).

trans-unit.source: By default, all users will be targeted.
trans-unit.target: By default, all users will be targeted.

trans-unit.source: If you set <codeInline>pushMode</codeInline> property to <codeInline>manual</codeInline>, the only thing you can specify in the audience is the push quota filter.
trans-unit.target: If you set <codeInline>pushMode</codeInline> property to <codeInline>manual</codeInline>, the only thing you can specify in the audience is the push quota filter.

trans-unit.source: A flag indicating if the campaign is protected by an access key.
trans-unit.target: A flag indicating if the campaign is protected by an access key.

trans-unit.source: If the value is <codeInline>true</codeInline>, the following actions will require the same access key than the one provided in the Create command:
trans-unit.target: If the value is <codeInline>true</codeInline>, the following actions will require the same access key than the one provided in the Create command:

trans-unit.source: Defines how the campaign is pushed.
trans-unit.target: Defines how the campaign is pushed.

trans-unit.source: In this mode, the campaign will be delivered only to your existing users (campaign will stop after that).
trans-unit.target: In this mode, the campaign will be delivered only to your existing users (campaign will stop after that).

trans-unit.source: In this mode, the campaign will not be pushed automatically to devices.
trans-unit.target: In this mode, the campaign will not be pushed automatically to devices.

trans-unit.source: You will have to use the <link xlink:href="c4947f45-9970-4baa-95fc-6ea116415430#push" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Push</link> command to push the campaign to your end-users.
trans-unit.target: You will have to use the <link xlink:href="c4947f45-9970-4baa-95fc-6ea116415430#push" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Push</link> command to push the campaign to your end-users.

trans-unit.source: Campaigns can be pushed multiple times to the same device.
trans-unit.target: Campaigns can be pushed multiple times to the same device.

trans-unit.source: Native push payload as described in the <link xlink:href="5d034027-19ee-4a86-afb1-7f21a3911678#payload_format" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Payload format</link>.
trans-unit.target: Native push payload as described in the <link xlink:href="5d034027-19ee-4a86-afb1-7f21a3911678#payload_format" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Payload format</link>.

trans-unit.source: Reach campaigns can be localized using an optional JSON object.
trans-unit.target: Reach campaigns can be localized using an optional JSON object.

trans-unit.source: The JSON key is a two-character language code as specified by the ISO 639-1 standard.
trans-unit.target: The JSON key is a two-character language code as specified by the ISO 639-1 standard.

trans-unit.source: The corresponding value is an object containing the localizable property <codeInline>payload</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The corresponding value is an object containing the localizable property <codeInline>payload</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The format of the payload is the same as the one specified by <externalLink><linkText>Apple</linkText><linkUri>http://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/NetworkingInternet/Conceptual/RemoteNotificationsPG/ApplePushService/ApplePushService.html</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The format of the payload is the same as the one specified by <externalLink><linkText>Apple</linkText><linkUri>http://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/NetworkingInternet/Conceptual/RemoteNotificationsPG/ApplePushService/ApplePushService.html</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: With the APS notification payload, you can include the following parameters: badge, alert, and sound.
trans-unit.target: With the APS notification payload, you can include the following parameters: badge, alert, and sound.

trans-unit.source: The payload can only be 256 bytes.
trans-unit.target: The payload can only be 256 bytes.

trans-unit.source: The badge is the number within a red circle that appears on an application’s home screen icon.
trans-unit.target: The badge is the number within a red circle that appears on an application’s home screen icon.

trans-unit.source: Apple requires an integer be sent as the badge value in the APS payload.
trans-unit.target: Apple requires an integer be sent as the badge value in the APS payload.

trans-unit.source: However, Mobile Engagement provides a way to send increments and decrements of the badge value.
trans-unit.target: However, Mobile Engagement provides a way to send increments and decrements of the badge value.

trans-unit.source: The badge value is stored on our server, as an appInfo.
trans-unit.target: The badge value is stored on our server, as an appInfo.

trans-unit.source: You can update it using the <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#tag" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tag</link> command or using the SDK’s <codeInline>sendAppInfo</codeInline> function.
trans-unit.target: You can update it using the <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#tag" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tag</link> command or using the SDK’s <codeInline>sendAppInfo</codeInline> function.

trans-unit.source: Three types of auto badging can be used:
trans-unit.target: Three types of auto badging can be used:

trans-unit.source: We will take the current stored badge value (<codeInline>badge</codeInline> appInfo) and insert that.
trans-unit.target: We will take the current stored badge value (<codeInline>badge</codeInline> appInfo) and insert that.

trans-unit.source: We will take the <codeInline>badge</codeInline> appInfo value, increment by the number after the + sign, and also increment our stored badge by that number.
trans-unit.target: We will take the <codeInline>badge</codeInline> appInfo value, increment by the number after the + sign, and also increment our stored badge by that number.

trans-unit.source: Same as above, except that we decrement instead of increment.
trans-unit.target: Same as above, except that we decrement instead of increment.

trans-unit.source: Simple message with an increment of the badge value:
trans-unit.target: Simple message with an increment of the badge value:

trans-unit.source: Custom payload using the default badge value:
trans-unit.target: Custom payload using the default badge value:

trans-unit.source: Two types of Windows Phone push notifications are currently supported: toast and tile
trans-unit.target: Two types of Windows Phone push notifications are currently supported: toast and tile

trans-unit.source: The final payload cannot exceed 32 kilobytes (the API will return an error if the payload is too big).
trans-unit.target: The final payload cannot exceed 32 kilobytes (the API will return an error if the payload is too big).

trans-unit.source: A toast in MPNS can have two texts: <codeInline>text1</codeInline> and <codeInline>text2</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: A toast in MPNS can have two texts: <codeInline>text1</codeInline> and <codeInline>text2</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>text1</codeInline> is the title of the notification, and <codeInline>text2</codeInline> is the content.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>text1</codeInline> is the title of the notification, and <codeInline>text2</codeInline> is the content.

trans-unit.source: At least one this field is required.
trans-unit.target: At least one this field is required.

trans-unit.source: The toast texts must be specified in a <codeInline>toast</codeInline> field inside a JSON object.
trans-unit.target: The toast texts must be specified in a <codeInline>toast</codeInline> field inside a JSON object.

trans-unit.source: Simple toast with both text1 and text2:
trans-unit.target: Simple toast with both text1 and text2:

trans-unit.source: To send a tile notification, set the JSON <codeInline>tile</codeInline> field with the xml data of the tile as a string.
trans-unit.target: To send a tile notification, set the JSON <codeInline>tile</codeInline> field with the xml data of the tile as a string.

trans-unit.source: You can combine a toast and a tile notification in a single native push campaign.
trans-unit.target: You can combine a toast and a tile notification in a single native push campaign.

trans-unit.source: You just need to set the two fields: <codeInline>tile</codeInline> and <codeInline>toast</codeInline> in the JSON object.
trans-unit.target: You just need to set the two fields: <codeInline>tile</codeInline> and <codeInline>toast</codeInline> in the JSON object.
